org.propelgraph

Interface WavefrontTraversableGraph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Graph

    public interface WavefrontTraversableGraph
extends Graph
    This interface exists to provide a generic interface for a method to do breadth-first search while maximizing any parallelism that the graph implementation might have.
    Author:
    ccjason (11/9/2014)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<Vertex> getVertices(Set<Vertex> setRootVertices, Direction direction, String label)
      Obtains the vertices that are adjacent to the specified vertices in the specified direction along edges with the specified label.
      Set<Vertex> getVerticesByRootIds(Set<String> setRootVertices, Direction direction, String label)
      behaves as getVertices except that the setRootVertices parameter specifies the id of the vertices rather than the Vertex pointer.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph

        addEdge, addVertex, getEdge, getEdges, getEdges, getFeatures, getVertex, getVertices, getVertices, query, removeEdge, removeVertex, shutdown

    • Method Detail

      • getVertices

        Set<Vertex> getVertices(Set<Vertex> setRootVertices,
                      Direction direction,
                      String label)
                        throws IOException
        Obtains the vertices that are adjacent to the specified vertices in the specified direction along edges with the specified label. This method should work in a fashion similar to the TinkerPop Blueprints Vertex.getVertices() method.
        Parameters:
        setRootVertices - the set of vertices from which the traversal will be made.
        direction - direction of the traversal from the specified vertices.
        label - label of edges that should be considered.
        Returns:
        Set
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getVerticesByRootIds

        Set<Vertex> getVerticesByRootIds(Set<String> setRootVertices,
                               Direction direction,
                               String label)
                                 throws IOException
        behaves as getVertices except that the setRootVertices parameter specifies the id of the vertices rather than the Vertex pointer.
        Parameters:
        setRootVertices -
        direction -
        label -
        Returns:
        Set
        Throws:
        IOException
